required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Everyday Activity Supports You (EASY) Pilot Study
clinical_study.official_title: Everyday Activity Supports You (EASY) Pilot Study

brief_summary.textblock: The investigators propose a 6-month, parallel, single-blind randomized controlled trial (RCT) feasibility study of a self-management program to reduce sedentary time and increase physical activity (Sit Less to Move More) in women aged 55-70 years. The primary aim is to determine feasibility and acceptability of the intervention; and the secondary aim is to test the effect of the intervention on the primary health outcome, physical activity (mean daily step count by accelerometry) at 6 months. The investigators will also conduct an economic evaluation and a process evaluation to guide a future larger study and to inform a scaled-up implementation plan.

primary_outcome.measure: Feasibility of Study Recruitment and Retention
primary_outcome.description: The number of study participants recruited and finish the 6 month study (and final assessment).

secondary_outcome.measure: Sedentary Time (Measured by Average Daily Percent)
secondary_outcome.description: sedentary time (measured by average daily percent) as measured by accelerometry
steps counts as measured by accelerometry
Self reported description of minutes/week of active transportation (e.g., walking, cycling, etc.)

arm_group.description: Participants in the intervention group will receive a self-management program designed to reduce sedentary behaviour and increase physical activity. Specifically, they will be given an EASY Program Manual with strategies to break up sitting time during the day and increase utilitarian activity; this will include a section on how to set, monitor and maintain achievable goals. They will also be offered a pedometer program, group education sessions and encouraged to use public transport by providing free bus tickets.
Control group participants will be offered monthly drop-in sessions that target information on general health and well-being unrelated to physical activity.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Healthy community-dwelling women aged 55-70 years who (via self-report) are not currently engaging (or in the previous 3 months) in any strength training, or <30 minutes brisk walking or moderate exercise/week
- are able to climb stairs and walk 400 meters (e.g., do not have a mobility disability).
Exclusion Criteria:
- Participants who receive treatment for medical conditions that preclude participation in a walking program

facility.name: Centre for Hip Health and Mobility

reference.citation: Ashe MC, Winters M, Hoppmann CA, Dawes MG, Gardiner PA, Giangregorio LM, Madden KM, McAllister MM, Wong G, Puyat JH, Singer J, Sims-Gould J, McKay HA. "Not just another walking program": Everyday Activity Supports You (EASY) model-a randomized pilot study for a parallel randomized controlled trial. Pilot Feasibility Stud. 2015;1:4. doi: 10.1186/2055-5784-1-4. Epub 2015 Jan 12.

measure.title: Sex: Female, Male
measure.population: 1 participant in the intervention group did not complete the study, and 4 participants in the control group did not complete the study.

measure.title: Region of Enrollment
measure.population: 1 participant from the intervention and 4 participants in the control group did not complete the study.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
